problems.text: Ben sells candies in a pattern: 3 on day 1, 6 on day 2, 9 on day 3. How many will he sell on day 15?
problems.hint: This is an arithmetic sequence. Each day he sells 3 more candies than the previous day.

problems.text: A wall is built by placing 10 bricks on the first row, 13 on the second, and so on. How many bricks are in 7 rows?
problems.hint: This is the sum of an arithmetic sequence for the total bricks in 7 rows.
steps: Use the sum formula: S_n = n/2 × (2a + (n - 1)d)

problems.text: A student scores 5 points in game 1, 8 in game 2, 11 in game 3. What is the total score after 6 games?
problems.hint: This is the sum of an arithmetic sequence for scores over games.
steps: Use the sum formula: S_n = n/2 × [2a + (n - 1)d]

problems.text: A gardener plants 2 trees the first day, 5 on the second, 8 on the third, continuing the pattern. How many trees after 6 days?
problems.hint: This is the sum of an arithmetic sequence for trees planted over days.
steps: Use the sum formula: S_n = n/2 × (2a + (n - 1)d)
